content: Yes, the UNHCR has helped resettle refugees to many different countries around the world. One example is the United States. In recent years, the UNHCR has worked with the U.S. government to resettle refugees from countries such as Syria, Afghanistan, and Somalia. Through its resettlement program, the UNHCR helps refugees find a new home where they can rebuild their lives in safety and dignity. The resettlement process includes identifying eligible refugees, screening them for security and health concerns, and providing them with support and services as they integrate into their new communities.
